document_data.name: Beguiling Rebuke
document_data.mainbody: '''''Beguiling rebuke''''' was a unique [[enchantment]] [[charm]] [[spell]] from the sixth circle of magic used in the late 15{{th}} century [[DR]].
document_data.Effects: The ''beguiling rebuke'' spell was cast as a reaction, mere moments after the caster was attacked. Once activated, the rebuked assailant and their nearby allies had a nigh chance of temporarily becoming beguiled. This charming effect, if successful, stopped the affected creatures from attacking the caster for twelve seconds. This magical rebuke had the range of {{SI|60'|'"|long=yes}}. The effects of ''beguiling rebuke'' could not be strengthened by a casting at a higher proficiency level.
document_data.History: This unique sell was known and was used by the [[cambion]] spawn of [[Mephistopheles]], [[Raphael]] during the [[Absolute crisis]] of the {{YearlinkName|1492}}, were he to stand against the [[Absolute Adversaries]] during their foray into the [[House of Hope (Avernus)|House of Hope]] in [[Avernus]].
